sentences.en: Fielding was not ashamed to practise a little necromancy.
sentences.cn: 菲尔丁不知羞耻地施展小巫术.

sentences.en: He advocated, though he did not practise. the prohibition of alcohol.
sentences.cn: 虽然还没付诸实施,但他主张禁止饮酒.

sentences.en: He began to practise medicine when he was young.
sentences.cn: 当他年青时,他就开始行医.

sentences.en: He ought to practise what he preaches.
He used to practise usury frequently.
If you don't use ( ie practise ) your English you'll forget it.
In Belgium only qualified doctors may practise alternative medicine.
sentences.cn: 在比利时只有资质合格的医生才能从事非传统医学工作。

sentences.en: It gives students the opportunity to practice their speaking skills.
sentences.cn: 这给学生提供了锻炼口才的机会。

sentences.en: No two sorts of birds practise quite the same sort of flight.
sentences.cn: 任何哪两种鸟,其飞行方式都不可能是完全相同的.

sentences.en: She and I used to practise drawing and writing poetry together.
sentences.cn: 我们天天在一处学画,学诗.

sentences.en: The chemical plant proposed to increase production and practise economy and other factories presently responded.
sentences.cn: 化工厂提出增产节约的倡仪,其他工厂随即响应.

sentences.en: The doctor is licensed to practise medicine.
They moved the furniture back to practise their dance routine.
sentences.cn: 他们把家具往后挪以便练习舞蹈动作。

sentences.en: We must practise the strictest frugality and economy.
sentences.cn: 我们必须实行最严格意义上的俭省节约。

sentences.en: We should increase production and practise strict economy.
sentences.cn: 我们应当增加生产,厉行节约.

sentences.en: You should practise as well as preach, Mr. Arabin.
sentences.cn: 你应该既讲道理又实践, 阿拉宾先生.

sentences.en: You should practise what you tell other people to do.
sentences.cn: 你叫别人去做的事,你自己应该实行.

words.tran_cn: 可用的；行得通的；可实行的
实践；练习；惯做（practise的过去分词）
练习，实践；实施，实行；从事

trans.tran_en: to do an activity, often regularly, in order to improve your skill or to prepare for a test

trans.tran_cn: 练习，实习，积极从事，执业
